projects.title: Esports Portfolio Site
projects.description: A personal portfolio site created for a prominent Esports professional, developed using HTML/CSS and pure JavaScript. With a heavy focus on design and UX; resulting in a more unique and memorable experience.
projects.descriptionTwo: The client requested the design to minimalistic with edited pre-existing high quality media content adding visual flare to the site.

projects.title: Personal Portfolio Site
projects.description: The site you are currently visiting - a place I can show off creative projects, blog interesting ideas or share relevant topics and handy guides i’ve found along the way.
projects.descriptionTwo: Developed using HTML/CSS and React, this project provided useful insight into new development practices, and the potential benefits of using these technologies when handling topics such as dynamically displaying content.

projects.title: LEGO Rubik's Cube Solver
projects.description: A project which tied together multiple areas which are of personal interest, using robotics for automation and mathematical or logical puzzles. As a child I was always intrigued by puzzles such as sudoku’s, the rules around them and the implications they can have when taken further - quickly indulging when given the opportunity to develop this project as my dissertation piece at university.
projects.descriptionTwo: Other notable parts of development were in regards to image categorisation in the form of colour recognition and detection.

projects.title: VoIP System
projects.description: VoIP systems are something I’ve personally used and taken for granted for a long time. This project provided hands on experience with the intricacies involved with both sending and receiving voice across the internet.
projects.descriptionTwo: Being given a variety of sockets, each one had to be analysed to identify any unwanted communication conditions, then researching and implementing solutions to provide a more functional system.

projects.title: Augmented Reality App
projects.description: Each year the University of East Anglia holds on Open Day, allowing non-students in to explore the campus and its facilities. We were tasked with producing applications that may be useful for these visitors.
projects.descriptionTwo: An Augmented Reality application seemed like a stretch given the timeframe - but after some research and crafty workarounds it was achievable - allowing visitors to retrieve information about spots around campus on the go!

projects.title: Room Finder App
projects.description: Each year the University of East Anglia holds on Open Day, allowing non-students in to explore the campus and its facilities. We were tasked with producing applications that may be useful for these visitors.
projects.descriptionTwo: Exploring a new campus can be daunting, especially with UEA's many walkways -  the Room finder application ensures users can find their way around campus, incase they're seperated from their guide or simply want to focus on the areas that interest them.

projects.title: Car Finder App
projects.description: Each year the University of East Anglia holds on Open Day, allowing non-students in to explore the campus and its facilities. We were tasked with producing applications that may be useful for these visitors.
projects.descriptionTwo: After spending the entire day walking around a new cammpus, the last thing you want it to walk around it again, trying to remember where you parked. Thanks to this app, remembering where you parked is a problem of the past.

projects.title: Image Categorisation
projects.description: During the Computer Vision module I undertook at university, I was tasked with implementing Image Categorisation algorithms with mutatable parameters.
projects.descriptionTwo: Comparing different algorithms and testing parameters to achieve the highest accuracy of true positives possible.
